intro: Hypochaeris radiata, commonly known as the lesser mouse-ear cress, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and features basal leaves that are lobed or heart-shaped. Its bright yellow flowers bloom from spring to early summer, and the plant is often found in disturbed soils, roadsides, and meadows. Hypochaeris radiata is an annual or biennial herb that spreads through seeds dispersed by wind and animals.
